channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Famine is spreading in Sudan, a global hunger authority says
item.description: The war involving the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces has created the world's largest humanitarian disaster, a leading hunger agency says. The major...

item.title: Despite a ceasefire, Israel has demolished villages in southern Lebanon
item.description: Along Lebanon's border, Israel has continued demolitions and attacks despite a ceasefire in the country's war with Hezbollah last year.

item.title: Judge says Trump administration must fund SNAP. And, what to know about NYC's election
item.description: Two judges have ordered the Trump administration to fund SNAP benefits. And, New York City voters head to the polls tomorrow to choose between Zohran ...

item.title: Huggies maker Kimberly-Clark is buying Tylenol maker Kenvue
item.description: One of the biggest mergers of the year, worth $49 billion, comes just weeks after the Trump administration linked the common painkiller to autism, whi...

item.title: Gender inequality accelerates Japan's rural depopulation
item.description: Akita Prefecture has Japan's most aged population, lowest birthrate and fastest declining population. Rigid gender roles are prompting young women to ...

item.title: Government shutdown feud between Democrats and Republicans drags on as SNAP recipients struggle
item.description: The government shutdown continues as Democrats and Republicans remain at odds over a funding plan. Meanwhile, SNAP recipients across the U.S. are conc...

item.title: Is COVID-19 during pregnancy linked to autism? New study offers clues
item.description: A large study from Massachusetts found that babies whose mothers had COVID-19 while pregnant were slightly more likely to have a range of neurodevelop...

item.title: 2025 elections in NYC, New Jersey, Virginia to test Democrats, Trump
item.description: Election Day 2025 is almost here, with consequential races in New York City, New Jersey, Virginia and a redistricting ballot measure in California.

item.title: Trump says he doubts US will go to war with Venezuela
item.description: The US president also suggests Nicolás Maduro's days as the South American country's leader are numbered.

item.title: Public barred as Tanzanian president sworn in
item.description: President Samia faced little opposition with key rivals either imprisoned or barred from running.

item.title: Hamas returns 3 more Israeli hostages' remains, leaving 8 still in Gaza
item.description: Among the 8 deceased Israeli hostages whose remains are yet to be returned from Gaza is soldier and U.S. citizen Itay Chen.

item.title: Israeli military's ex-top lawyer arrested over leak of video allegedly showing Palestinian detainee abuse
item.description: Maj Gen Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi resigned on Friday, admitting leaking a video allegedly showing abuse of a Palestinian detainee.

item.title: The Trump administration faces a Monday deadline to tell judges if it will fully fund SNAP
Maldives bans smoking for younger generations
item.description: Anyone born on or after 1 January 2007 will be banned from using, buying or selling tobacco products in the archipelago.

item.title: Government shutdown nears record for longest ever as Senate returns
item.description: The government shutdown stretches into Day 34 on Monday as the Senate is set to reconvene. Follow live updates here.

item.title: Drones seen over Belgian military base for third night, minister says
item.description: The country's Defence Minister Theo Francken said it looked like an espionage operation, but he wanted to be "cautious" about speculating.

item.title: Judge again bars Trump administration from deploying troops to Portland
Hearings to focus on National Guard deployments in the nation’s capital and Memphis, Tennessee
item.description: Hearings are set in two states over the deployment of the National Guard as part of President Donald Trump’s crime-fighting efforts.
